meanings.definition: The court of an Indian ruler.
meanings.sent1: The durbar was filled with important people waiting to speak to the ruler.
meanings.sent2: The king held his durbar in the grand hall of the palace.
meanings.sent3: The durbar turned into a lively gathering with music and dancing.
meanings.sent4: The durbar resembled a colorful tapestry of diverse individuals.
meanings.sent5: The grandeur of the durbar left a lasting impression on all who attended.

meanings.sent1: The ambassador attended the durbar to present his credentials to the dignitaries.
meanings.sent2: The durbar was a display of elegance and protocol.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected guest at the durbar caused a stir among the attendees.
meanings.sent4: The durbar felt like a scene from a royal drama unfolding before their eyes.
meanings.sent5: The atmosphere of the durbar was filled with anticipation and excitement.
